news.title: BBC and news agencies warn journalists in Gaza at risk of starvation
news.summary: News organisations say local journalists are increasingly unable to feed themselves in Gaza, facing the same "dire circumstances as those they are covering".

news.title: Mum and children killed in Northern Ireland shooting named
news.summary: The investigation is at an early stage but a suspected triple murder and attempted suicide is one line of inquiry, police say.

news.title: White House pushes back after reports Trump is named in Epstein files
news.summary: It came as a US judge denied a justice department's bid to unseal Florida court files on Epstein.

news.title: Forget 10,000 - just 7,000 steps is enough for health benefits, says study
news.summary: Everyone targets 10,000 steps - but a lower tally could reduce the risk of serious health issues like cancer, dementia and heart disease, a study suggests.

news.title: 'See story through my eyes', says UK teen on trial for drug smuggling in Georgia
news.summary: The teenager from Billingham, Teesside, is on trial in Georgia on drug smuggling charges.

news.title: Jeremy Corbyn confirms launch of new political party
news.summary: Corbyn issues a statement with fellow Independent MP Zarah Sultana to launch "a new kind of political party".

news.title: Investigation into claims asylum seeker payment cards used for gambling
news.summary: More than 6,500 payments in gambling settings were attempted by asylum seekers in the past year.

news.title: Twelve killed in Thailand-Cambodia military clashes on disputed border
news.summary: The fighting marks an escalation of a century-old conflict between the two South East Asian neighbours.

news.title: Starmer and Modi sign Â£6bn India-UK trade deal
news.summary: The free trade deal is expected to cut tariffs on goods and increase market access for both countries.

news.title: Students feel 'let down' by mental health support - but should it really be up to universities?
news.summary: The number of students reporting mental health concerns is rising. But to what extent should the onus be on universities?
